N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 15.5 - Informal admissions

State Regulations
(a) The
commissioner hereby approves all State hospitals and all facilities certified
in the hospitals class to receive persons suitable therefor on an informal
basis. (b) Any suitable person over
16 years of age in need of care and treatment requesting admission may be
admitted on an informal basis. (c) A copy of the notice of status and rights given to a person admitted on an
informal basis shall be sent to the Mental Health Information Service. The copy
of such notice of a person admitted to a general hospital psychiatric unit need
not contain the patient's name but, if it does not, it shall include
identification of the patient by number and room or ward location to enable the

Mental Health Information Service representative to contact him
readily. (d) Form 473 DMH, Acceptance of Informal Admission,is prescribed for use in State and private
hospitals. If such form is not used in a general hospital, the patient's record
shall clearly show that the patient has been admitted on an informal basis and
document the patient's suitability therefor. Notes
